summary: Even before COVID-19, the federal government's long-term fiscal path was unsustainable because debt was growing faster than the economy. By the end of FY 2019, debt held by the public had climbed to 79% of GDP. It is expected to reach 195% of GDP by FY 2050. We testified that the federal government does not have a long-term fiscal plan to control the growing debt...
title: The Nation's Fiscal Health: A Long-Term Plan Is Needed for Fiscal Sustainability
